timeline.bodyText:
Only do Value.
I now remember the discussion ages ago. Getting a Value doesn't mean setting the value will actually set it back on the data holder. You have to offer it back. A DataProvider in common can reject it.
Nothing should stop your Value from not being written to how you like though.
@gabizou
timeline.author: Zidane
Zidane

replies.bodyText: I am preferring they're always Mutable from entities. It does make sense that they are reflective of their Key variables, but at the end of the day, the developer is likely to want to mutate the value and maybe offer it back, or present it to another entity after mutation.
replies.author: gabizou
